The file event can't be serialized to the database safely without the content.

columns.description: List of columns in this table/resource

score.description: Search relevance score (0 = exact match, higher = less relevant)

conditioning.description: Optional conditioning prompt for the LLM matcher

source_table.description: Source table name (entities to match from)

target_table.description: Target table name (entities to match to)

job_ids.description: IDs of the created match jobs

DatasetDescriptor.description:
A dataset is where you put multiple referential schemas.

A dataset is a complete namespace where all references between schemas
are held within the dataset.

Thinking.description: Thinking tokens for Claude 3.7. Contains the budget in tokens for thinking.

object_id.description: The ID of the schema object that was deleted

object_type.description: The type of schema object that was deleted

domains.description: A comma-separated string of domains to restrict the search to

exclude_domains.description: A comma-separated string of domains to remove from the results

language.description: The 2-letter ISO-639-1 code of the language you want to get headlines for

page.description: Use this to page through the results if the total results found is greater than page size

page_size.description: The number of results to return per page (default: 20, max: 100)

q.description: Keywords or phrases to search for in the article title and body

q_in_title.description: Keywords or phrases to search for in the article title only

sort_by.description: The order to sort the articles in

sources.description: A comma-separated string of sources or blogs to get articles from

total_results.description: The total number of results available for your request

ExplorationPhaseId.description:
Identifies the phase of connector exploration

This enum is used to track which phase of exploration a chat session belongs to.
It's stored as JSONB in the database to allow for flexible phase identification.

oneOf.description: First phase: discovering all databases in the connector
Second phase: discovering all schemas in a database
Third phase: discovering all tables in a schema
Fourth phase: discovering columns for a specific table
Initial phase: discovering all API resources
Second phase: discovering fields for a specific API resource

file_path.description: The path of the file to delete

number.description: The number by which the flag is referred in image, prompt, and tool calls.

width.description:
The serde default here is to give us backwards compatibility
it's fine for these to be anything as long as the image isn't
given since it won't regenerate.

reason.description: A reason for the job's existence

JobWithEvents.description: A job paired with all its associated events

LLMKey.description: LLM model keys available in the system. Format: <provider>.<model-name>

LLMKnowledgeGraph.description:
Knowledge graph info structured to deserialize and display
in the same format that the LLM outputs.
Also the first representation of an LLM output in the pipeline from raw tool output to being merged into a DB

dataset.description: Dataset name to optionally filter jobs by

limit.description: Number of results to return (default: 1000, max: 1000)

source_table.description: Source table name to get matches for

LlmInformationStore.description:
Information store for connector schema

Hierarchical structure: Connector  Database  Schema  Table  Column
Works for both relational databases and API-based data.
Distinguishes between the two by presence of `endpoint` on tables:
- Relational DB: all tables have `endpoint: None`
- API: all tables have `endpoint: Some(...)`

databases.description: List of databases in this connector

uses_default_hierarchy.description:
Whether this store uses default auto-generated database/schema names
(i.e., database and schema names match the connector name).
When true, UIs should hide the database/schema hierarchy.
When false, UIs should show the full database  schema  table hierarchy.

q.description: The location query to search for

Membership.description: Contains membership information and API token value

MergeConfig.description: The configuration for a probabilistic merge strategy

baseline_cardinality.description:
The number of unique values that are expected to be present in the complete dataset

This is used for merging to determine how significant a match is. (i.e. if there are
only 2 possible values, a match gives less confidence than if there are 100)

match_transfer_probability.description:
The estimated probability that, given an entity match, the properties also match

For a person's full name, this would be quite high. For a person's job title, it
would be lower because people can have multiple job titles over time or at different
companies at the same time.

oneOf.description:
Property with unique 1:1 correspondence to its parent.

Merge based on this property 100% of the time

Message.description: Our generic definition of a message to a chat agent.

content.description:
We want this to be a vec of contents so we can accurately
capture an interleaving of images and text.

This is meant to be a completely raw, unprocessed representation
of the text. Don't take stuff out.

oneOf.description: Money string that includes currency and amount: $10k, 100.00, 1 million CAD, 1e8 etc.
oneOf.title: MoneyString

content.description: The unformatted content of the article

description.description: A description or snippet from the article

published_at.description: The date and time that the article was published

title.description: The headline or title of the article

url.description: The direct URL to the article

url_to_image.description: The URL to a relevant image for the article

id.description: The identifier id of the news source

name.description: The name of the news source

category.description: The type of news to expect from this news source

country.description: The country this news source is based in (or primarily targets)

description.description: A description of the news source

id.description: The identifier of the news source

language.description: The language that this news source writes in

name.description: A display-suitable name for the news source

PDFIngestor.description: Ingest all pages of a PDF and process them independently.

oneOf.description: Date string in formats: 'YYYY', 'YYYY-MM', 'YYYY-MM-DD', 'DD-MM-YYYY', 'MM-DD-YYYY', 'Jan 3, 2023', '3 Jan 2023', '2023 Apr 3', etc.
oneOf.title: PartialDateString

is_likely_to_engage.description: Whether this is an exact match

PromptMeta.description: All metadata required to generate a prompt for the LLM

source_cardinality_given_target_match.description:
Describes the expected cardinality of the source table when a match is found in the target table

For example, if we have a source company and a target funding round, we expect the source company
to appear in multiple funding rounds, but not *too* many.
So if we have a funding round match, the expected number of unique companies is relatively small.
This is an estimate of that number.

target_cardinality_given_source_match.description:
Describes the expected cardinality of the target table when a match is found in the source table

For example, if we have a source company and a target funding round, we usually expect
some number of funding rounds to be associated with a single company but not *too* many.
So if we have a company match, the expected number of unique funding rounds is relatively small.
This is an estimate of that number.

seeded_entity_id.description: The integer id corresponding to an entity in the seeded entity graph (different from the global dataset entity id)

property_names.description: If there are multiple properties, it can match just one of them

table_name.description: The table name of the entity to update

post.description:
JWTs are commonly used for authentication in web applications. They contain
encoded information about the user and are typically short-lived for security reasons.

This endpoint exists to allow clients who have authenticated via JWT (e.g., through
Supabase) to obtain a long-lived API token. The API token can then be used
for subsequent requests to the API without requiring frequent re-authentication.

This conversion process enhances security by separating the authentication mechanism
(JWT) from the API access mechanism (API token), while providing a seamless experience
for users transitioning from web-based authentication to API usage.

parameters.description: JWT to convert to API token
parameters.name: jwt

post.summary: Converts a JWT (JSON Web Token) to an API token.

post.description:
This endpoint allows clients to extend their session by providing both the current
session token and refresh token. Upon successful refresh, a new session token is issued
and the old session is revoked.
post.summary: Refreshes an expired or expiring session token.
